content:
Wine is a great addition to any grocery list! $8 is a great price point for a decent bottle of wine. You might want to consider stocking up on a few bottles if you find a good deal.

I'm glad you mentioned quinoa and canned goods! Those are great staples to have in your pantry. Here are a few more items you might want to consider adding to your list:

**Grains:**

* Quinoa (you mentioned this one already)
* Brown rice
* Whole wheat pasta
* Oats (for oatmeal or baking)

**Canned goods:**

* Beans (black, kidney, or cannellini)
* Canned tomatoes
* Tuna (in water or olive oil)
* Soups (vegetable, tomato, or black bean)
* Broth (chicken or vegetable)
* Coconut milk (if you use it in recipes)

**Pantry extras:**

* Nut butters (peanut butter, almond butter, etc.)
* Canned or dried fruits (for oatmeal or snacking)
* Honey or maple syrup (for sweetening)
* Spices and seasonings (cumin, chili powder, basil, etc.)

**Snacks:**

* Nuts (almonds, walnuts, etc.)
* Dried fruit (cranberries, raisins, etc.)
* Dark chocolate chips (for a sweet treat)

Remember, these are just suggestions based on your previous purchases and common pantry staples. Feel free to adjust the list to fit your personal preferences and dietary needs.

Also, since you're trying to cut back on spending, you might want to consider buying in bulk or shopping during sales. Many grocery stores offer loyalty programs or digital coupons that can help you save even more money.
